examples: They're very odd people.
There's something odd about that man.
That painting looks very odd.
a teenage girl with rather odd hair
After a while she noticed something quite odd.
When we got inside something struck me as odd.

it is/seems odd that… It seems odd that nobody noticed anything wrong.
It's most odd that (= very odd that) she hasn't written.
The odd thing was that he didn't recognize me.
it is odd to do something It's odd to think I will never see her again.
I didn't think it odd at the time.

meanings.def: strange or unusual in the way mentioned
examples: an odd-looking house
an odd-sounding name

meanings.def: that cannot be divided exactly by the number two
examples: 1, 3, 5 and 7 are odd numbers.
Each section may have an odd or even number of players.

meanings.def: happening or appearing occasionally; not happening often
examples: He makes the odd mistake—nothing too serious.

meanings.def: of no particular type or size; various
examples: decorations made of odd scraps of paper

meanings.def: not with the pair or set that it belongs to; not matching
examples: You're wearing odd socks!
Could I see you when you've got an odd moment?

meanings.def: approximately or a little more than the number mentioned
examples: How old is she—seventy odd?
He's worked there for twenty-odd years.

meanings.def: a person or thing that is different from others or does not fit easily into a group or set
examples: At school he was always the odd man out.
Dog, cat, horse, shoe—which is the odd one out?

meanings.def: a person who is slightly strange or crazy
